title: Spellbook of charm monster
data:
| [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") of +   charm monster   [![Light green spellbook.png](/images/7/7d/Light_green_spellbook.png)](/wiki/File:Light_green_spellbook.png) |                                                               |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Appearance                                                                                                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Abundance                                                                                                                                                                    | [2.03%](/wiki/Spellbook#Generation "Spellbook")               |
|                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                               |
| Base price                                                                                                                                                                   | 300 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                                                                                                                       | [50](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |
| Turns to read                                                                                                                                                                | 6                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                                                                                                                                 | [15–29](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                               |
| Spell type                                                                                                                                                                   | [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment_spells "Enchantment spells")  |
| Level                                                                                                                                                                        | 3                                                             |
| Power cost                                                                                                                                                                   | 15 [Pw](/wiki/Power "Power")                                  |
| Direction                                                                                                                                                                    | non-directional                                               |
| Equivalent                                                                                                                                                                   | [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming") |
| Special for                                                                                                                                                                  | [tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                            |

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **spellbook of charm monster** can be [read](/wiki/Read "Read") to learn the **spell of charm monster**. It is a level 3 [enchantment spell](/wiki/Enchantment_spell "Enchantment spell"), and the spellbook takes roughly 6 turns to read. It is the [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit c73595cc](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/c73595cc96a63637b180d18e9fb48d147e03cc88), charm monster is now a level 5 spell, and the spellbook requires 25-49 magic marker charges to write. The book takes 15 turns to read, although the defined delay is unchanged.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

There is a \~2.03% chance that a randomly-generated spellbook will be a spellbook of charm monster.

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may start the game with this spellbook as one of their non-[force bolt](/wiki/Force_bolt "Force bolt") spellbooks.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A spellbook of charm monster requires 15 to 29 charges from a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") to write.

## Description

This spell has the basic effect of an uncursed [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming") at all skill levels:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) adjacent monsters may become pacified or even tame, depending on their level and [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), and angry [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") are pacified regardless of MR score.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) [Covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters, [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") and [humans](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") such as [guards](/wiki/Guard "Guard"), [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") and shopkeepers can only be made [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful"), and the same is true of [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") unless you are in the form of a demon yourself.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") and the [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses") cannot be pacified or tamed.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

If cast while engulfed, the spell will only affect the engulfer, and they will release you if tamed or pacified.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Strategy

Charm monster is one of the better spells available to players: characters that can gain skill in [enchantment spells](/wiki/Enchantment_spells "Enchantment spells") or else gain enough levels to cast it even at Unskilled can tame some very powerful monsters. Some in particular, such as [minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") and [mastodons](/wiki/Mastodon "Mastodon"), will never resist it as they have no [MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), while others such as [arch-liches](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich") have such a high level and [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") that you may be unable to even pacify them at all.

Any role that can reliably cast the spell can utilize it in emergencies to pacify or even tame sufficiently dangerous monsters at the current stage of the game - very few monsters in the early stages of the game have an appreciable MR score, and while some monsters such as [soldier ants](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant") may not be especially strong pets, any character will prefer a tamed ant to a hostile one that [ends their game](/wiki/YAAD "YAAD").

## History

All spellbooks were introduced in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 169](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L169)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 930](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L930): *`maybetame` function*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1402](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1402): *both the scroll and spell call `maybetame`*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 942](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L942)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 876](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dog.c#L876)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 924](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dog.c#L924)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 871](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dog.c#L871)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1405](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1405)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Spellbook of charm monster

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
spellbook of
+   charm monster  
Appearance random
Abundance 2.03%
Base price 300 zm
Weight 50
Turns to read 6
Ink to write 15–29
Spell type enchantment
Level 3
Power cost 15 Pw
Direction non-directional
Equivalent scroll of taming
Special for tourist

In NetHack, the spellbook of charm monster can be read to learn the spell of charm monster. It is a level 3 enchantment spell, and the spellbook takes roughly 6 turns to read. It is the special spell for Tourists.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit c73595cc, charm monster is now a level 5 spell, and the spellbook requires 25-49 magic marker charges to write. The book takes 15 turns to read, although the defined delay is unchanged.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 References

Generation

There is a ~2.03% chance that a randomly-generated spellbook will be a spellbook of charm monster.

Wizards may start the game with this spellbook as one of their non-force bolt spellbooks.[1]

A spellbook of charm monster requires 15 to 29 charges from a magic marker to write.

Description

This spell has the basic effect of an uncursed scroll of taming at all skill levels:[2][3] adjacent monsters may become pacified or even tame, depending on their level and MR score, and angry shopkeepers are pacified regardless of MR score.[4][5] Covetous monsters, minions and humans such as guards, aligned priests and shopkeepers can only be made peaceful, and the same is true of major demons unless you are in the form of a demon yourself.[6] The Wizard of Yendor, Medusa and the quest nemeses cannot be pacified or tamed.[7]

If cast while engulfed, the spell will only affect the engulfer, and they will release you if tamed or pacified.[8]

Strategy

Charm monster is one of the better spells available to players: characters that can gain skill in enchantment spells or else gain enough levels to cast it even at Unskilled can tame some very powerful monsters. Some in particular, such as minotaurs and mastodons, will never resist it as they have no MR, while others such as arch-liches have such a high level and MR score that you may be unable to even pacify them at all.

Any role that can reliably cast the spell can utilize it in emergencies to pacify or even tame sufficiently dangerous monsters at the current stage of the game - very few monsters in the early stages of the game have an appreciable MR score, and while some monsters such as soldier ants may not be especially strong pets, any character will prefer a tamed ant to a hostile one that ends their game.

History

All spellbooks were introduced in NetHack 1.3d.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 169
  2. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 930: maybetame function
  3. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1402: both the scroll and spell call maybetame
  4. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 942
  5. ↑ src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 876
  6. ↑ src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 924
  7. ↑ src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 871
  8. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1405
